result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alejandro R Vasquez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alejandro R Vasquez appeared by video.  Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith appeared by video for Alejandro R Vasquez.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Attorney Smith has been retained by the defendant.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alejandro R Vasquez appeared by video.  Attorney Edward J. Ritger appeared by video for Alejandro R Vasquez.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Attorney Ritger recently retained by defendant and requests additional time to review discovery with client.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Defendant Alejandro R Vasquez in court with attorney Edward J. Ritger.  Gerald Alder for Amanda Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Statements by defense that defendant seeking to retain different counsel. Case adjourned for status of counsel, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alejandro R Vasquez in court with attorney Edward J. Ritger.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alejandro R Vasquez in court with attorney Edward J. Ritger.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Alejandro R Vasquez in court with attorney Edward J. Ritger.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
